detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Opens PYUSD to USD Conversions for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. Users can send funds abroad to a recipient’s bank account, a mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. The announcement also highlighted PayPal’s goals for PYUSD, aiming to create a stable value to maximize user confidence and ensure utility for commerce and payments. On the same day, Ripple announced the launch of its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD Stablecoin for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers via PYUSD to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. The service allows funds to be sent to a recipient’s bank account, mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. On the same day, Ripple announced it would launch its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD Stablecoin for International Transfers, Aiming to Reduce Costs
detailed_analysis.body: Silicon Valley-based payments giant PayPal is expanding the use of its PYUSD stablecoin by allowing U.S. clients to send international money transfers using the cryptocurrency. Starting Thursday, through its cross-border payments service Xoom, customers can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries without transaction fees. PayPal aims to offer more cost-effective international money transfer solutions, citing a World Bank report on the high global average cost of sending money. The fintech company is also looking to increase the adoption of its stablecoin, launched last year, and establish itself as a trusted entity in digital assets. This move comes as the stablecoin market heats up, with competitors like Ripple launching their own stablecoins for enterprise clients. Currently, Tether's USDT and Circle's USDC are leading in terms of supply.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Supports Cross-Border Transfers and Payments
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has integrated its PYUSD stablecoin with Xoom Finance, enabling cross-border transfers and payments for a wider audience.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Releases February 2024 Transparency Report for PYUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Paxos released its transparency report for PYUSD in February 2024, revealing an increase in the total external circulation of PYUSD by approximately 1.08% compared to the previous period. As of March 1, 2024, the total tokens outstanding were 304,427,933. The report also detailed the current market value and nominal position value of the collateral in various categories, including the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement, other cash deposits with depositary institutions, and the total net assets. The market value of the collateral in the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement was approximately $311,025,637, with a nominal position value of about $304,927,000. The market value and nominal position value of the collateral held in other cash deposits were both $812,281. Lastly, the total net assets' current market value was approximately $311,837,918, with a nominal position value of about $305,739,282.

detailed_analysis.title: PYUSD Joins Universal Digital Payments Network to Address Traditional Payment Challenges
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on February 9th that Paxos announced its collaboration with PayPal to issue the PYUSD stablecoin, which has joined the Universal Digital Payments Network. This move aims to help PYUSD better address the high costs, complex processes, and slow settlement issues typically associated with traditional payment mechanisms. The Universal Digital Payments Network is a global messaging network based on Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), designed to bridge the gap between traditional payment infrastructure and modern digital currencies.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Ventures Invests $6.5 Million in Crypto Transfer Platform Mesh Using PYUSD Stablecoin
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal Ventures invests $6.5 million in crypto transfer platform Mesh, with $5 million paid in PYUSD stablecoin. This marks PayPal Ventures' first known crypto investment since May 2023. Mesh is building a product for users to move crypto between different financial accounts and wallets. The investment in stablecoins as opposed to fiat was not immediately clear. Mesh co-founder and CEO Bam Azizi expressed excitement about the investment in PYUSD, highlighting its 24/7 functionality and low cost. Despite doubling its market capitalization, PYUSD remains the eleventh-largest stablecoin. The future development and priority of PYUSD within PayPal are uncertain.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Hits $290M, Growing 70% in One Month
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin has experienced a significant increase in market capitalization, reaching over $290 million, a 70% growth over the past month. Launched in August through a partnership with Paxos, PYUSD's total supply was initially 43.3 million, with Paxos holding 90% of the supply. The stablecoin's adoption on centralized exchanges and integration into DeFi protocols have contributed to its growth. Crypto.com now holds the largest portion of PYUSD, and DeFi protocols like Curve have integrated it into their systems. On-chain activity shows a trend of PYUSD being swapped for other stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, and its daily trading volume is around $29 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Seeks DeFi Integration for Liquidity
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin, which has been trailing more established stablecoins such as USDT and USDC, is leveraging DeFi to give itself a liquidity boost. PYUSD activated the Curve automated market maker in December and is seeking deployment on Aave. Despite the initial buzz around PayPal entering the stablecoin market with PYUSD, it faces challenges in trade volumes compared to leading stablecoins. To combat this, Paxos, the entity behind PYUSD, has partnered with Trident Digital to improve on-chain liquidity. The Curve platform launched the FRAXPYUSD liquidity pool, which has become the third-largest on Curve with $135 million in TVL. The pool includes FRAX Finance's collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, FRAX, and allows FRAX holders to swap for PYUSD for use on the PayPal app. Aave is currently voting on whether to onboard PYUSD into its Ethereum pool, with the initial vote ending on January 11, 2024. If successful, Paxos and associated parties plan to seed the liquidity pool with $5-10 million.

Despite facing competition from established stablecoins like USDT and Circle, PYUSD aims to be used for payments, crypto trading, and on centralized exchanges. extracted_news.title: Paxos Releases PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024
extracted_news.body: Paxos has officially released the PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024, revealing a total circulation of approximately $188 million. The report details the main audit data as of April 1, 2024, including the total amount of outstanding tokens at $188,485,924, the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bonds at approximately $14.87 million, and the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bond-collateralized reverse repurchase agreements at approximately $177.99 million. The total net assets' current market value is approximately $192.86 million.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversions for International Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal is expanding its international transfer options by enabling PYUSD to USD conversions for its users in the United States. This new feature allows U.S. customers to use the PayPal USD (PYUSD) stablecoin for money transfers to friends and family abroad. However, PYUSD is not available to residents of Hawaii. Through PayPal's cross-border payments platform, Xoom, users can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to approximately 160 countries without any transaction fees. Jose Fernandez da Ponte, Senior Vice President of the Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and Digital Currency Group at PayPal, emphasized that this development aims to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and offer a secure, low-cost way to send money internationally. The stablecoin market is becoming increasingly competitive, with several alternatives emerging to challenge the dominance of Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC. PayPal launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023, in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to facilitate cost-effective international payments and remittances. The launch was well-received in the crypto industry, with several prominent exchanges listing PYUSD. However, in November, PayPal received a subpoena from the SEC regarding its stablecoin.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Usable for Xoom Cross-Border Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal Holdings Inc.'s Xoom cross-border money transfer service now allows customers to send funds abroad using dollars converted from the PayPal USD stablecoin, PYUSD. This marks a significant move in the integration of cryptocurrency into international remittances. PayPal introduced PYUSD, pegged to the dollar and issued by Paxos Trust Co., last August, becoming the first large financial services company to release a public stablecoin. Customers can redeem PYUSD for dollars and use the stablecoin to fund purchases and buy other cryptocurrencies.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD to USD Conversions for Global Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal has introduced PYUSD to USD conversions for cross-border transfers, offering a seamless and cost-effective solution for global money transfers. This new feature, available through PayPal's online money transfer service Xoom, allows users in the United States (excluding Hawaii) to send money to over 160 countries without transaction fees. Users can fund their transfers with USD converted from PayPal's native stablecoin, PYUSD, enhancing the ease and reliability of international money transfers. The service was announced on April 4 and leverages PayPal's cryptocurrency hub for conversions without additional sale fees. PayPal initially launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023 in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to streamline payments in virtual environments and facilitate cost-effective transfers. The stablecoin market is witnessing increased activity, with competition intensifying as alternatives to market leaders like Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC emerge.

BLOCKBEATS NEWS, ON APRIL 4, XOOM, A CROSS-BORDER REMITTANCE SERVICE OWNED BY PAYPAL, ANNOUNCED TODAY THAT IT NOW ALLOWS U.S. XOOM USERS TO CONVERT THEIR PAYPAL STABLECOIN PYUSD INTO U.S. DOLLARS AND USE IT AS A SOURCE OF FUNDS TO ABOUT 160 COUNTRIES AROUND THE WORLD. /AREA FOR REMITTANCE.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Opens PYUSD to USD Conversions for Cross-Border Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. Users can send funds abroad to a recipient’s bank account, a mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. The announcement also highlighted PayPal’s goals for PYUSD, aiming to create a stable value to maximize user confidence and ensure utility for commerce and payments. On the same day, Ripple announced the launch of its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD Stablecoin for International Transfers, Aiming to Reduce Costs
extracted_news.body: Silicon Valley-based payments giant PayPal is expanding the use of its PYUSD stablecoin by allowing U.S. clients to send international money transfers using the cryptocurrency. Starting Thursday, through its cross-border payments service Xoom, customers can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries without transaction fees. PayPal aims to offer more cost-effective international money transfer solutions, citing a World Bank report on the high global average cost of sending money. The fintech company is also looking to increase the adoption of its stablecoin, launched last year, and establish itself as a trusted entity in digital assets. This move comes as the stablecoin market heats up, with competitors like Ripple launching their own stablecoins for enterprise clients. Currently, Tether's USDT and Circle's USDC are leading in terms of supply.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Supports Cross-Border Transfers and Payments

extracted_news.title: Paxos Releases February 2024 Transparency Report for PYUSD
extracted_news.body: Paxos released its transparency report for PYUSD in February 2024, revealing an increase in the total external circulation of PYUSD by approximately 1.08% compared to the previous period. As of March 1, 2024, the total tokens outstanding were 304,427,933. The report also detailed the current market value and nominal position value of the collateral in various categories, including the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement, other cash deposits with depositary institutions, and the total net assets. The market value of the collateral in the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement was approximately $311,025,637, with a nominal position value of about $304,927,000. The market value and nominal position value of the collateral held in other cash deposits were both $812,281. Lastly, the total net assets' current market value was approximately $311,837,918, with a nominal position value of about $305,739,282.

extracted_news.title: PYUSD Joins Universal Digital Payments Network to Address Traditional Payment Challenges
extracted_news.body: BlockBeats reported on February 9th that Paxos announced its collaboration with PayPal to issue the PYUSD stablecoin, which has joined the Universal Digital Payments Network. This move aims to help PYUSD better address the high costs, complex processes, and slow settlement issues typically associated with traditional payment mechanisms. The Universal Digital Payments Network is a global messaging network based on Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), designed to bridge the gap between traditional payment infrastructure and modern digital currencies.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Ventures Invests $6.5 Million in Crypto Transfer Platform Mesh Using PYUSD Stablecoin
extracted_news.body: PayPal Ventures invests $6.5 million in crypto transfer platform Mesh, with $5 million paid in PYUSD stablecoin. This marks PayPal Ventures' first known crypto investment since May 2023. Mesh is building a product for users to move crypto between different financial accounts and wallets. The investment in stablecoins as opposed to fiat was not immediately clear. Mesh co-founder and CEO Bam Azizi expressed excitement about the investment in PYUSD, highlighting its 24/7 functionality and low cost. Despite doubling its market capitalization, PYUSD remains the eleventh-largest stablecoin. The future development and priority of PYUSD within PayPal are uncertain.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Hits $290M, Growing 70% in One Month
extracted_news.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin has experienced a significant increase in market capitalization, reaching over $290 million, a 70% growth over the past month. Launched in August through a partnership with Paxos, PYUSD's total supply was initially 43.3 million, with Paxos holding 90% of the supply. The stablecoin's adoption on centralized exchanges and integration into DeFi protocols have contributed to its growth. Crypto.com now holds the largest portion of PYUSD, and DeFi protocols like Curve have integrated it into their systems. On-chain activity shows a trend of PYUSD being swapped for other stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, and its daily trading volume is around $29 million.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Seeks DeFi Integration for Liquidity
extracted_news.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin, which has been trailing more established stablecoins such as USDT and USDC, is leveraging DeFi to give itself a liquidity boost. PYUSD activated the Curve automated market maker in December and is seeking deployment on Aave. Despite the initial buzz around PayPal entering the stablecoin market with PYUSD, it faces challenges in trade volumes compared to leading stablecoins. To combat this, Paxos, the entity behind PYUSD, has partnered with Trident Digital to improve on-chain liquidity. The Curve platform launched the FRAXPYUSD liquidity pool, which has become the third-largest on Curve with $135 million in TVL. The pool includes FRAX Finance's collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, FRAX, and allows FRAX holders to swap for PYUSD for use on the PayPal app. Aave is currently voting on whether to onboard PYUSD into its Ethereum pool, with the initial vote ending on January 11, 2024. If successful, Paxos and associated parties plan to seed the liquidity pool with $5-10 million.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Releases PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024
detailed_analysis.body: Paxos has officially released the PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024, revealing a total circulation of approximately $188 million. The report details the main audit data as of April 1, 2024, including the total amount of outstanding tokens at $188,485,924, the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bonds at approximately $14.87 million, and the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bond-collateralized reverse repurchase agreements at approximately $177.99 million. The total net assets' current market value is approximately $192.86 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversions for International Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal is expanding its international transfer options by enabling PYUSD to USD conversions for its users in the United States. This new feature allows U.S. customers to use the PayPal USD (PYUSD) stablecoin for money transfers to friends and family abroad. However, PYUSD is not available to residents of Hawaii. Through PayPal's cross-border payments platform, Xoom, users can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to approximately 160 countries without any transaction fees. Jose Fernandez da Ponte, Senior Vice President of the Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and Digital Currency Group at PayPal, emphasized that this development aims to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and offer a secure, low-cost way to send money internationally. The stablecoin market is becoming increasingly competitive, with several alternatives emerging to challenge the dominance of Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC. PayPal launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023, in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to facilitate cost-effective international payments and remittances. The launch was well-received in the crypto industry, with several prominent exchanges listing PYUSD. However, in November, PayPal received a subpoena from the SEC regarding its stablecoin.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Usable for Xoom Cross-Border Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal Holdings Inc.'s Xoom cross-border money transfer service now allows customers to send funds abroad using dollars converted from the PayPal USD stablecoin, PYUSD. This marks a significant move in the integration of cryptocurrency into international remittances. PayPal introduced PYUSD, pegged to the dollar and issued by Paxos Trust Co., last August, becoming the first large financial services company to release a public stablecoin. Customers can redeem PYUSD for dollars and use the stablecoin to fund purchases and buy other cryptocurrencies.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD to USD Conversions for Global Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has introduced PYUSD to USD conversions for cross-border transfers, offering a seamless and cost-effective solution for global money transfers. This new feature, available through PayPal's online money transfer service Xoom, allows users in the United States (excluding Hawaii) to send money to over 160 countries without transaction fees. Users can fund their transfers with USD converted from PayPal's native stablecoin, PYUSD, enhancing the ease and reliability of international money transfers. The service was announced on April 4 and leverages PayPal's cryptocurrency hub for conversions without additional sale fees. PayPal initially launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023 in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to streamline payments in virtual environments and facilitate cost-effective transfers. The stablecoin market is witnessing increased activity, with competition intensifying as alternatives to market leaders like Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC emerge.

BLOCKBEATS NEWS, ON APRIL 4, XOOM, A CROSS-BORDER REMITTANCE SERVICE OWNED BY PAYPAL, ANNOUNCED TODAY THAT IT NOW ALLOWS U.S. XOOM USERS TO CONVERT THEIR PAYPAL STABLECOIN PYUSD INTO U.S. DOLLARS AND USE IT AS A SOURCE OF FUNDS TO ABOUT 160 COUNTRIES AROUND THE WORLD. /AREA FOR REMITTANCE.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Opens PYUSD to USD Conversions for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. Users can send funds abroad to a recipient’s bank account, a mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. The announcement also highlighted PayPal’s goals for PYUSD, aiming to create a stable value to maximize user confidence and ensure utility for commerce and payments. On the same day, Ripple announced the launch of its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD Stablecoin for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers via PYUSD to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. The service allows funds to be sent to a recipient’s bank account, mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. On the same day, Ripple announced it would launch its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD Stablecoin for International Transfers, Aiming to Reduce Costs
detailed_analysis.body: Silicon Valley-based payments giant PayPal is expanding the use of its PYUSD stablecoin by allowing U.S. clients to send international money transfers using the cryptocurrency. Starting Thursday, through its cross-border payments service Xoom, customers can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries without transaction fees. PayPal aims to offer more cost-effective international money transfer solutions, citing a World Bank report on the high global average cost of sending money. The fintech company is also looking to increase the adoption of its stablecoin, launched last year, and establish itself as a trusted entity in digital assets. This move comes as the stablecoin market heats up, with competitors like Ripple launching their own stablecoins for enterprise clients. Currently, Tether's USDT and Circle's USDC are leading in terms of supply.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Supports Cross-Border Transfers and Payments
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has integrated its PYUSD stablecoin with Xoom Finance, enabling cross-border transfers and payments for a wider audience.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Releases February 2024 Transparency Report for PYUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Paxos released its transparency report for PYUSD in February 2024, revealing an increase in the total external circulation of PYUSD by approximately 1.08% compared to the previous period. As of March 1, 2024, the total tokens outstanding were 304,427,933. The report also detailed the current market value and nominal position value of the collateral in various categories, including the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement, other cash deposits with depositary institutions, and the total net assets. The market value of the collateral in the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement was approximately $311,025,637, with a nominal position value of about $304,927,000. The market value and nominal position value of the collateral held in other cash deposits were both $812,281. Lastly, the total net assets' current market value was approximately $311,837,918, with a nominal position value of about $305,739,282.

detailed_analysis.title: PYUSD Joins Universal Digital Payments Network to Address Traditional Payment Challenges
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on February 9th that Paxos announced its collaboration with PayPal to issue the PYUSD stablecoin, which has joined the Universal Digital Payments Network. This move aims to help PYUSD better address the high costs, complex processes, and slow settlement issues typically associated with traditional payment mechanisms. The Universal Digital Payments Network is a global messaging network based on Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), designed to bridge the gap between traditional payment infrastructure and modern digital currencies.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Ventures Invests $6.5 Million in Crypto Transfer Platform Mesh Using PYUSD Stablecoin
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal Ventures invests $6.5 million in crypto transfer platform Mesh, with $5 million paid in PYUSD stablecoin. This marks PayPal Ventures' first known crypto investment since May 2023. Mesh is building a product for users to move crypto between different financial accounts and wallets. The investment in stablecoins as opposed to fiat was not immediately clear. Mesh co-founder and CEO Bam Azizi expressed excitement about the investment in PYUSD, highlighting its 24/7 functionality and low cost. Despite doubling its market capitalization, PYUSD remains the eleventh-largest stablecoin. The future development and priority of PYUSD within PayPal are uncertain.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Hits $290M, Growing 70% in One Month
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin has experienced a significant increase in market capitalization, reaching over $290 million, a 70% growth over the past month. Launched in August through a partnership with Paxos, PYUSD's total supply was initially 43.3 million, with Paxos holding 90% of the supply. The stablecoin's adoption on centralized exchanges and integration into DeFi protocols have contributed to its growth. Crypto.com now holds the largest portion of PYUSD, and DeFi protocols like Curve have integrated it into their systems. On-chain activity shows a trend of PYUSD being swapped for other stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, and its daily trading volume is around $29 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Seeks DeFi Integration for Liquidity
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin, which has been trailing more established stablecoins such as USDT and USDC, is leveraging DeFi to give itself a liquidity boost. PYUSD activated the Curve automated market maker in December and is seeking deployment on Aave. Despite the initial buzz around PayPal entering the stablecoin market with PYUSD, it faces challenges in trade volumes compared to leading stablecoins. To combat this, Paxos, the entity behind PYUSD, has partnered with Trident Digital to improve on-chain liquidity. The Curve platform launched the FRAXPYUSD liquidity pool, which has become the third-largest on Curve with $135 million in TVL. The pool includes FRAX Finance's collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, FRAX, and allows FRAX holders to swap for PYUSD for use on the PayPal app. Aave is currently voting on whether to onboard PYUSD into its Ethereum pool, with the initial vote ending on January 11, 2024. If successful, Paxos and associated parties plan to seed the liquidity pool with $5-10 million.

PYUSD's adoption and liquidity are being boosted through Aave's Ethereum pool and activation on the automated market maker Curve. Despite facing competition from established stablecoins like USDT and Circle, PYUSD aims to be used for payments, crypto trading, and on centralized exchanges. Paxos, the issuer of PYUSD, is collaborating with Trident Digital to enhance the stablecoin's on-chain liquidity and is planning to seed the Aave pool with $5-10 million in liquidity if the proposal passes.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Releases PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024
extracted_news.body: Paxos has officially released the PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024, revealing a total circulation of approximately $188 million. The report details the main audit data as of April 1, 2024, including the total amount of outstanding tokens at $188,485,924, the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bonds at approximately $14.87 million, and the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bond-collateralized reverse repurchase agreements at approximately $177.99 million. The total net assets' current market value is approximately $192.86 million.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversions for International Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal is expanding its international transfer options by enabling PYUSD to USD conversions for its users in the United States. This new feature allows U.S. customers to use the PayPal USD (PYUSD) stablecoin for money transfers to friends and family abroad. However, PYUSD is not available to residents of Hawaii. Through PayPal's cross-border payments platform, Xoom, users can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to approximately 160 countries without any transaction fees. Jose Fernandez da Ponte, Senior Vice President of the Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and Digital Currency Group at PayPal, emphasized that this development aims to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and offer a secure, low-cost way to send money internationally. The stablecoin market is becoming increasingly competitive, with several alternatives emerging to challenge the dominance of Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC. PayPal launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023, in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to facilitate cost-effective international payments and remittances. The launch was well-received in the crypto industry, with several prominent exchanges listing PYUSD. However, in November, PayPal received a subpoena from the SEC regarding its stablecoin.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Usable for Xoom Cross-Border Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal Holdings Inc.'s Xoom cross-border money transfer service now allows customers to send funds abroad using dollars converted from the PayPal USD stablecoin, PYUSD. This marks a significant move in the integration of cryptocurrency into international remittances. PayPal introduced PYUSD, pegged to the dollar and issued by Paxos Trust Co., last August, becoming the first large financial services company to release a public stablecoin. Customers can redeem PYUSD for dollars and use the stablecoin to fund purchases and buy other cryptocurrencies.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD to USD Conversions for Global Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal has introduced PYUSD to USD conversions for cross-border transfers, offering a seamless and cost-effective solution for global money transfers. This new feature, available through PayPal's online money transfer service Xoom, allows users in the United States (excluding Hawaii) to send money to over 160 countries without transaction fees. Users can fund their transfers with USD converted from PayPal's native stablecoin, PYUSD, enhancing the ease and reliability of international money transfers. The service was announced on April 4 and leverages PayPal's cryptocurrency hub for conversions without additional sale fees. PayPal initially launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023 in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to streamline payments in virtual environments and facilitate cost-effective transfers. The stablecoin market is witnessing increased activity, with competition intensifying as alternatives to market leaders like Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC emerge.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Opens PYUSD to USD Conversions for Cross-Border Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. Users can send funds abroad to a recipient’s bank account, a mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. The announcement also highlighted PayPal’s goals for PYUSD, aiming to create a stable value to maximize user confidence and ensure utility for commerce and payments. On the same day, Ripple announced the launch of its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD Stablecoin for International Transfers, Aiming to Reduce Costs
extracted_news.body: Silicon Valley-based payments giant PayPal is expanding the use of its PYUSD stablecoin by allowing U.S. clients to send international money transfers using the cryptocurrency. Starting Thursday, through its cross-border payments service Xoom, customers can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries without transaction fees. PayPal aims to offer more cost-effective international money transfer solutions, citing a World Bank report on the high global average cost of sending money. The fintech company is also looking to increase the adoption of its stablecoin, launched last year, and establish itself as a trusted entity in digital assets. This move comes as the stablecoin market heats up, with competitors like Ripple launching their own stablecoins for enterprise clients. Currently, Tether's USDT and Circle's USDC are leading in terms of supply.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Releases February 2024 Transparency Report for PYUSD
extracted_news.body: Paxos released its transparency report for PYUSD in February 2024, revealing an increase in the total external circulation of PYUSD by approximately 1.08% compared to the previous period. As of March 1, 2024, the total tokens outstanding were 304,427,933. The report also detailed the current market value and nominal position value of the collateral in various categories, including the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement, other cash deposits with depositary institutions, and the total net assets. The market value of the collateral in the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement was approximately $311,025,637, with a nominal position value of about $304,927,000. The market value and nominal position value of the collateral held in other cash deposits were both $812,281. Lastly, the total net assets' current market value was approximately $311,837,918, with a nominal position value of about $305,739,282.

extracted_news.title: PYUSD Joins Universal Digital Payments Network to Address Traditional Payment Challenges
extracted_news.body: BlockBeats reported on February 9th that Paxos announced its collaboration with PayPal to issue the PYUSD stablecoin, which has joined the Universal Digital Payments Network. This move aims to help PYUSD better address the high costs, complex processes, and slow settlement issues typically associated with traditional payment mechanisms. The Universal Digital Payments Network is a global messaging network based on Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), designed to bridge the gap between traditional payment infrastructure and modern digital currencies.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Ventures Invests $6.5 Million in Crypto Transfer Platform Mesh Using PYUSD Stablecoin
extracted_news.body: PayPal Ventures invests $6.5 million in crypto transfer platform Mesh, with $5 million paid in PYUSD stablecoin. This marks PayPal Ventures' first known crypto investment since May 2023. Mesh is building a product for users to move crypto between different financial accounts and wallets. The investment in stablecoins as opposed to fiat was not immediately clear. Mesh co-founder and CEO Bam Azizi expressed excitement about the investment in PYUSD, highlighting its 24/7 functionality and low cost. Despite doubling its market capitalization, PYUSD remains the eleventh-largest stablecoin. The future development and priority of PYUSD within PayPal are uncertain.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Hits $290M, Growing 70% in One Month
extracted_news.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin has experienced a significant increase in market capitalization, reaching over $290 million, a 70% growth over the past month. Launched in August through a partnership with Paxos, PYUSD's total supply was initially 43.3 million, with Paxos holding 90% of the supply. The stablecoin's adoption on centralized exchanges and integration into DeFi protocols have contributed to its growth. Crypto.com now holds the largest portion of PYUSD, and DeFi protocols like Curve have integrated it into their systems. On-chain activity shows a trend of PYUSD being swapped for other stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, and its daily trading volume is around $29 million.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Seeks DeFi Integration for Liquidity
extracted_news.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin, which has been trailing more established stablecoins such as USDT and USDC, is leveraging DeFi to give itself a liquidity boost. PYUSD activated the Curve automated market maker in December and is seeking deployment on Aave. Despite the initial buzz around PayPal entering the stablecoin market with PYUSD, it faces challenges in trade volumes compared to leading stablecoins. To combat this, Paxos, the entity behind PYUSD, has partnered with Trident Digital to improve on-chain liquidity. The Curve platform launched the FRAXPYUSD liquidity pool, which has become the third-largest on Curve with $135 million in TVL. The pool includes FRAX Finance's collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, FRAX, and allows FRAX holders to swap for PYUSD for use on the PayPal app. Aave is currently voting on whether to onboard PYUSD into its Ethereum pool, with the initial vote ending on January 11, 2024. If successful, Paxos and associated parties plan to seed the liquidity pool with $5-10 million.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Releases PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024
detailed_analysis.body: Paxos has officially released the PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024, revealing a total circulation of approximately $188 million. The report details the main audit data as of April 1, 2024, including the total amount of outstanding tokens at $188,485,924, the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bonds at approximately $14.87 million, and the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bond-collateralized reverse repurchase agreements at approximately $177.99 million. The total net assets' current market value is approximately $192.86 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversions for International Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal is expanding its international transfer options by enabling PYUSD to USD conversions for its users in the United States. This new feature allows U.S. customers to use the PayPal USD (PYUSD) stablecoin for money transfers to friends and family abroad. However, PYUSD is not available to residents of Hawaii. Through PayPal's cross-border payments platform, Xoom, users can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to approximately 160 countries without any transaction fees. Jose Fernandez da Ponte, Senior Vice President of the Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and Digital Currency Group at PayPal, emphasized that this development aims to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and offer a secure, low-cost way to send money internationally. The stablecoin market is becoming increasingly competitive, with several alternatives emerging to challenge the dominance of Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC. PayPal launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023, in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to facilitate cost-effective international payments and remittances. The launch was well-received in the crypto industry, with several prominent exchanges listing PYUSD. However, in November, PayPal received a subpoena from the SEC regarding its stablecoin.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Usable for Xoom Cross-Border Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal Holdings Inc.'s Xoom cross-border money transfer service now allows customers to send funds abroad using dollars converted from the PayPal USD stablecoin, PYUSD. This marks a significant move in the integration of cryptocurrency into international remittances. PayPal introduced PYUSD, pegged to the dollar and issued by Paxos Trust Co., last August, becoming the first large financial services company to release a public stablecoin. Customers can redeem PYUSD for dollars and use the stablecoin to fund purchases and buy other cryptocurrencies.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD to USD Conversions for Global Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has introduced PYUSD to USD conversions for cross-border transfers, offering a seamless and cost-effective solution for global money transfers. This new feature, available through PayPal's online money transfer service Xoom, allows users in the United States (excluding Hawaii) to send money to over 160 countries without transaction fees. Users can fund their transfers with USD converted from PayPal's native stablecoin, PYUSD, enhancing the ease and reliability of international money transfers. The service was announced on April 4 and leverages PayPal's cryptocurrency hub for conversions without additional sale fees. PayPal initially launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023 in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to streamline payments in virtual environments and facilitate cost-effective transfers. The stablecoin market is witnessing increased activity, with competition intensifying as alternatives to market leaders like Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC emerge.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Opens PYUSD to USD Conversions for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. Users can send funds abroad to a recipient’s bank account, a mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. The announcement also highlighted PayPal’s goals for PYUSD, aiming to create a stable value to maximize user confidence and ensure utility for commerce and payments. On the same day, Ripple announced the launch of its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD Stablecoin for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers via PYUSD to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. The service allows funds to be sent to a recipient’s bank account, mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. On the same day, Ripple announced it would launch its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD Stablecoin for International Transfers, Aiming to Reduce Costs
detailed_analysis.body: Silicon Valley-based payments giant PayPal is expanding the use of its PYUSD stablecoin by allowing U.S. clients to send international money transfers using the cryptocurrency. Starting Thursday, through its cross-border payments service Xoom, customers can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries without transaction fees. PayPal aims to offer more cost-effective international money transfer solutions, citing a World Bank report on the high global average cost of sending money. The fintech company is also looking to increase the adoption of its stablecoin, launched last year, and establish itself as a trusted entity in digital assets. This move comes as the stablecoin market heats up, with competitors like Ripple launching their own stablecoins for enterprise clients. Currently, Tether's USDT and Circle's USDC are leading in terms of supply.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Supports Cross-Border Transfers and Payments
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has integrated its PYUSD stablecoin with Xoom Finance, enabling cross-border transfers and payments for a wider audience.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Releases February 2024 Transparency Report for PYUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Paxos released its transparency report for PYUSD in February 2024, revealing an increase in the total external circulation of PYUSD by approximately 1.08% compared to the previous period. As of March 1, 2024, the total tokens outstanding were 304,427,933. The report also detailed the current market value and nominal position value of the collateral in various categories, including the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement, other cash deposits with depositary institutions, and the total net assets. The market value of the collateral in the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement was approximately $311,025,637, with a nominal position value of about $304,927,000. The market value and nominal position value of the collateral held in other cash deposits were both $812,281. Lastly, the total net assets' current market value was approximately $311,837,918, with a nominal position value of about $305,739,282.

detailed_analysis.title: PYUSD Joins Universal Digital Payments Network to Address Traditional Payment Challenges
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on February 9th that Paxos announced its collaboration with PayPal to issue the PYUSD stablecoin, which has joined the Universal Digital Payments Network. This move aims to help PYUSD better address the high costs, complex processes, and slow settlement issues typically associated with traditional payment mechanisms. The Universal Digital Payments Network is a global messaging network based on Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), designed to bridge the gap between traditional payment infrastructure and modern digital currencies.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Ventures Invests $6.5 Million in Crypto Transfer Platform Mesh Using PYUSD Stablecoin
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal Ventures invests $6.5 million in crypto transfer platform Mesh, with $5 million paid in PYUSD stablecoin. This marks PayPal Ventures' first known crypto investment since May 2023. Mesh is building a product for users to move crypto between different financial accounts and wallets. The investment in stablecoins as opposed to fiat was not immediately clear. Mesh co-founder and CEO Bam Azizi expressed excitement about the investment in PYUSD, highlighting its 24/7 functionality and low cost. Despite doubling its market capitalization, PYUSD remains the eleventh-largest stablecoin. The future development and priority of PYUSD within PayPal are uncertain.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Hits $290M, Growing 70% in One Month
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin has experienced a significant increase in market capitalization, reaching over $290 million, a 70% growth over the past month. Launched in August through a partnership with Paxos, PYUSD's total supply was initially 43.3 million, with Paxos holding 90% of the supply. The stablecoin's adoption on centralized exchanges and integration into DeFi protocols have contributed to its growth. Crypto.com now holds the largest portion of PYUSD, and DeFi protocols like Curve have integrated it into their systems. On-chain activity shows a trend of PYUSD being swapped for other stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, and its daily trading volume is around $29 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Seeks DeFi Integration for Liquidity
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin, which has been trailing more established stablecoins such as USDT and USDC, is leveraging DeFi to give itself a liquidity boost. PYUSD activated the Curve automated market maker in December and is seeking deployment on Aave. Despite the initial buzz around PayPal entering the stablecoin market with PYUSD, it faces challenges in trade volumes compared to leading stablecoins. To combat this, Paxos, the entity behind PYUSD, has partnered with Trident Digital to improve on-chain liquidity. The Curve platform launched the FRAXPYUSD liquidity pool, which has become the third-largest on Curve with $135 million in TVL. The pool includes FRAX Finance's collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, FRAX, and allows FRAX holders to swap for PYUSD for use on the PayPal app. Aave is currently voting on whether to onboard PYUSD into its Ethereum pool, with the initial vote ending on January 11, 2024. If successful, Paxos and associated parties plan to seed the liquidity pool with $5-10 million.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Releases PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024
extracted_news.body: Paxos has officially released the PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024, revealing a total circulation of approximately $188 million. The report details the main audit data as of April 1, 2024, including the total amount of outstanding tokens at $188,485,924, the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bonds at approximately $14.87 million, and the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bond-collateralized reverse repurchase agreements at approximately $177.99 million. The total net assets' current market value is approximately $192.86 million.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversions for International Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal is expanding its international transfer options by enabling PYUSD to USD conversions for its users in the United States. This new feature allows U.S. customers to use the PayPal USD (PYUSD) stablecoin for money transfers to friends and family abroad. However, PYUSD is not available to residents of Hawaii. Through PayPal's cross-border payments platform, Xoom, users can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to approximately 160 countries without any transaction fees. Jose Fernandez da Ponte, Senior Vice President of the Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and Digital Currency Group at PayPal, emphasized that this development aims to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and offer a secure, low-cost way to send money internationally. The stablecoin market is becoming increasingly competitive, with several alternatives emerging to challenge the dominance of Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC. PayPal launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023, in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to facilitate cost-effective international payments and remittances. The launch was well-received in the crypto industry, with several prominent exchanges listing PYUSD. However, in November, PayPal received a subpoena from the SEC regarding its stablecoin.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Usable for Xoom Cross-Border Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal Holdings Inc.'s Xoom cross-border money transfer service now allows customers to send funds abroad using dollars converted from the PayPal USD stablecoin, PYUSD. This marks a significant move in the integration of cryptocurrency into international remittances. PayPal introduced PYUSD, pegged to the dollar and issued by Paxos Trust Co., last August, becoming the first large financial services company to release a public stablecoin. Customers can redeem PYUSD for dollars and use the stablecoin to fund purchases and buy other cryptocurrencies.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD to USD Conversions for Global Money Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal has introduced PYUSD to USD conversions for cross-border transfers, offering a seamless and cost-effective solution for global money transfers. This new feature, available through PayPal's online money transfer service Xoom, allows users in the United States (excluding Hawaii) to send money to over 160 countries without transaction fees. Users can fund their transfers with USD converted from PayPal's native stablecoin, PYUSD, enhancing the ease and reliability of international money transfers. The service was announced on April 4 and leverages PayPal's cryptocurrency hub for conversions without additional sale fees. PayPal initially launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023 in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to streamline payments in virtual environments and facilitate cost-effective transfers. The stablecoin market is witnessing increased activity, with competition intensifying as alternatives to market leaders like Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC emerge.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversion for US Xoom Users
extracted_news.body:
PAYPAL: US USERS CAN NOW EXCHANGE PYUSD TO US DOLLARS THROUGH XOOM
BLOCKBEATS NEWS, ON APRIL 4, XOOM, A CROSS-BORDER REMITTANCE SERVICE OWNED BY PAYPAL, ANNOUNCED TODAY THAT IT NOW ALLOWS U.S. XOOM USERS TO CONVERT THEIR PAYPAL STABLECOIN PYUSD INTO U.S. DOLLARS AND USE IT AS A SOURCE OF FUNDS TO ABOUT 160 COUNTRIES AROUND THE WORLD. /AREA FOR REMITTANCE.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Opens PYUSD to USD Conversions for Cross-Border Transfers
extracted_news.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. Users can send funds abroad to a recipient’s bank account, a mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. The announcement also highlighted PayPal’s goals for PYUSD, aiming to create a stable value to maximize user confidence and ensure utility for commerce and payments. On the same day, Ripple announced the launch of its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD Stablecoin for Cross-Border Transfers

extracted_news.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD Stablecoin for International Transfers, Aiming to Reduce Costs
extracted_news.body: Silicon Valley-based payments giant PayPal is expanding the use of its PYUSD stablecoin by allowing U.S. clients to send international money transfers using the cryptocurrency. Starting Thursday, through its cross-border payments service Xoom, customers can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries without transaction fees. PayPal aims to offer more cost-effective international money transfer solutions, citing a World Bank report on the high global average cost of sending money. The fintech company is also looking to increase the adoption of its stablecoin, launched last year, and establish itself as a trusted entity in digital assets. This move comes as the stablecoin market heats up, with competitors like Ripple launching their own stablecoins for enterprise clients. Currently, Tether's USDT and Circle's USDC are leading in terms of supply.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Supports Cross-Border Transfers and Payments
extracted_news.body: PayPal has integrated its PYUSD stablecoin with Xoom Finance, enabling cross-border transfers and payments for a wider audience.

extracted_news.title: Paxos Releases February 2024 Transparency Report for PYUSD
extracted_news.body: Paxos released its transparency report for PYUSD in February 2024, revealing an increase in the total external circulation of PYUSD by approximately 1.08% compared to the previous period. As of March 1, 2024, the total tokens outstanding were 304,427,933. The report also detailed the current market value and nominal position value of the collateral in various categories, including the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement, other cash deposits with depositary institutions, and the total net assets. The market value of the collateral in the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement was approximately $311,025,637, with a nominal position value of about $304,927,000. The market value and nominal position value of the collateral held in other cash deposits were both $812,281. Lastly, the total net assets' current market value was approximately $311,837,918, with a nominal position value of about $305,739,282.

extracted_news.title: PYUSD Joins Universal Digital Payments Network to Address Traditional Payment Challenges
extracted_news.body: BlockBeats reported on February 9th that Paxos announced its collaboration with PayPal to issue the PYUSD stablecoin, which has joined the Universal Digital Payments Network. This move aims to help PYUSD better address the high costs, complex processes, and slow settlement issues typically associated with traditional payment mechanisms. The Universal Digital Payments Network is a global messaging network based on Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), designed to bridge the gap between traditional payment infrastructure and modern digital currencies.

extracted_news.title: PayPal Ventures Invests $6.5 Million in Crypto Transfer Platform Mesh Using PYUSD Stablecoin
extracted_news.body: PayPal Ventures invests $6.5 million in crypto transfer platform Mesh, with $5 million paid in PYUSD stablecoin. This marks PayPal Ventures' first known crypto investment since May 2023. Mesh is building a product for users to move crypto between different financial accounts and wallets. The investment in stablecoins as opposed to fiat was not immediately clear. Mesh co-founder and CEO Bam Azizi expressed excitement about the investment in PYUSD, highlighting its 24/7 functionality and low cost. Despite doubling its market capitalization, PYUSD remains the eleventh-largest stablecoin. The future development and priority of PYUSD within PayPal are uncertain.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Hits $290M, Growing 70% in One Month
extracted_news.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin has experienced a significant increase in market capitalization, reaching over $290 million, a 70% growth over the past month. Launched in August through a partnership with Paxos, PYUSD's total supply was initially 43.3 million, with Paxos holding 90% of the supply. The stablecoin's adoption on centralized exchanges and integration into DeFi protocols have contributed to its growth. Crypto.com now holds the largest portion of PYUSD, and DeFi protocols like Curve have integrated it into their systems. On-chain activity shows a trend of PYUSD being swapped for other stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, and its daily trading volume is around $29 million.

extracted_news.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Seeks DeFi Integration for Liquidity
extracted_news.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin, which has been trailing more established stablecoins such as USDT and USDC, is leveraging DeFi to give itself a liquidity boost. PYUSD activated the Curve automated market maker in December and is seeking deployment on Aave. Despite the initial buzz around PayPal entering the stablecoin market with PYUSD, it faces challenges in trade volumes compared to leading stablecoins. To combat this, Paxos, the entity behind PYUSD, has partnered with Trident Digital to improve on-chain liquidity. The Curve platform launched the FRAXPYUSD liquidity pool, which has become the third-largest on Curve with $135 million in TVL. The pool includes FRAX Finance's collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, FRAX, and allows FRAX holders to swap for PYUSD for use on the PayPal app. Aave is currently voting on whether to onboard PYUSD into its Ethereum pool, with the initial vote ending on January 11, 2024. If successful, Paxos and associated parties plan to seed the liquidity pool with $5-10 million.

extracted_news.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin is seeking deployment on Aave, with Paxos helping to create DeFi markets for the stablecoin. PYUSD's adoption and liquidity are being boosted through Aave's Ethereum pool and activation on the automated market maker Curve. Despite facing competition from established stablecoins like USDT and Circle, PYUSD aims to be used for payments, crypto trading, and on centralized exchanges. Paxos, the issuer of PYUSD, is collaborating with Trident Digital to enhance the stablecoin's on-chain liquidity and is planning to seed the Aave pool with $5-10 million in liquidity if the proposal passes.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Releases PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024
detailed_analysis.body: Paxos has officially released the PYUSD Transparency Report for March 2024, revealing a total circulation of approximately $188 million. The report details the main audit data as of April 1, 2024, including the total amount of outstanding tokens at $188,485,924, the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bonds at approximately $14.87 million, and the current market value of collateral in U.S. Treasury Bond-collateralized reverse repurchase agreements at approximately $177.99 million. The total net assets' current market value is approximately $192.86 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversions for International Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal is expanding its international transfer options by enabling PYUSD to USD conversions for its users in the United States. This new feature allows U.S. customers to use the PayPal USD (PYUSD) stablecoin for money transfers to friends and family abroad. However, PYUSD is not available to residents of Hawaii. Through PayPal's cross-border payments platform, Xoom, users can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to approximately 160 countries without any transaction fees. Jose Fernandez da Ponte, Senior Vice President of the Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, and Digital Currency Group at PayPal, emphasized that this development aims to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and offer a secure, low-cost way to send money internationally. The stablecoin market is becoming increasingly competitive, with several alternatives emerging to challenge the dominance of Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC. PayPal launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023, in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to facilitate cost-effective international payments and remittances. The launch was well-received in the crypto industry, with several prominent exchanges listing PYUSD. However, in November, PayPal received a subpoena from the SEC regarding its stablecoin.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Usable for Xoom Cross-Border Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal Holdings Inc.'s Xoom cross-border money transfer service now allows customers to send funds abroad using dollars converted from the PayPal USD stablecoin, PYUSD. This marks a significant move in the integration of cryptocurrency into international remittances. PayPal introduced PYUSD, pegged to the dollar and issued by Paxos Trust Co., last August, becoming the first large financial services company to release a public stablecoin. Customers can redeem PYUSD for dollars and use the stablecoin to fund purchases and buy other cryptocurrencies.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD to USD Conversions for Global Money Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has introduced PYUSD to USD conversions for cross-border transfers, offering a seamless and cost-effective solution for global money transfers. This new feature, available through PayPal's online money transfer service Xoom, allows users in the United States (excluding Hawaii) to send money to over 160 countries without transaction fees. Users can fund their transfers with USD converted from PayPal's native stablecoin, PYUSD, enhancing the ease and reliability of international money transfers. The service was announced on April 4 and leverages PayPal's cryptocurrency hub for conversions without additional sale fees. PayPal initially launched PYUSD on the Ethereum blockchain in August 2023 in collaboration with Paxos, aiming to streamline payments in virtual environments and facilitate cost-effective transfers. The stablecoin market is witnessing increased activity, with competition intensifying as alternatives to market leaders like Tether's USDT and Circle-backed USDC emerge.

BLOCKBEATS NEWS, ON APRIL 4, XOOM, A CROSS-BORDER REMITTANCE SERVICE OWNED BY PAYPAL, ANNOUNCED TODAY THAT IT NOW ALLOWS U.S. XOOM USERS TO CONVERT THEIR PAYPAL STABLECOIN PYUSD INTO U.S. DOLLARS AND USE IT AS A SOURCE OF FUNDS TO ABOUT 160 COUNTRIES AROUND THE WORLD. /AREA FOR REMITTANCE.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Opens PYUSD to USD Conversions for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. Users can send funds abroad to a recipient’s bank account, a mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. The announcement also highlighted PayPal’s goals for PYUSD, aiming to create a stable value to maximize user confidence and ensure utility for commerce and payments. On the same day, Ripple announced the launch of its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Launches PYUSD Stablecoin for Cross-Border Transfers
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has announced that it will allow all United States users, except those in Hawaii, to fund cross-border money transfers to family and friends abroad using U.S. dollars converted from its native stablecoin, PayPal USD (PYUSD). This service, powered by PayPal’s Xoom, enables money transfers via PYUSD to over 160 countries without any Xoom transaction fees. The service allows funds to be sent to a recipient’s bank account, mobile wallet address, or a financial institution for pickup. Transactions not denominated in U.S. dollars will be subject to currency conversion, which includes a spread. The issuance and custody of PayPal USD is performed by Paxos Trust Company in New York. Since its launch last August, close to $200 million PYUSD has been issued. On the same day, Ripple announced it would launch its own U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, and Nick Van Eck is set to launch a new U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin after closing a $12-million funding round.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Enables PYUSD Stablecoin for International Transfers, Aiming to Reduce Costs
detailed_analysis.body: Silicon Valley-based payments giant PayPal is expanding the use of its PYUSD stablecoin by allowing U.S. clients to send international money transfers using the cryptocurrency. Starting Thursday, through its cross-border payments service Xoom, customers can convert PYUSD to USD and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries without transaction fees. PayPal aims to offer more cost-effective international money transfer solutions, citing a World Bank report on the high global average cost of sending money. The fintech company is also looking to increase the adoption of its stablecoin, launched last year, and establish itself as a trusted entity in digital assets. This move comes as the stablecoin market heats up, with competitors like Ripple launching their own stablecoins for enterprise clients. Currently, Tether's USDT and Circle's USDC are leading in terms of supply.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Now Supports Cross-Border Transfers and Payments
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal has integrated its PYUSD stablecoin with Xoom Finance, enabling cross-border transfers and payments for a wider audience.

detailed_analysis.title: Paxos Releases February 2024 Transparency Report for PYUSD
detailed_analysis.body: Paxos released its transparency report for PYUSD in February 2024, revealing an increase in the total external circulation of PYUSD by approximately 1.08% compared to the previous period. As of March 1, 2024, the total tokens outstanding were 304,427,933. The report also detailed the current market value and nominal position value of the collateral in various categories, including the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement, other cash deposits with depositary institutions, and the total net assets. The market value of the collateral in the US Treasury reverse repurchase agreement was approximately $311,025,637, with a nominal position value of about $304,927,000. The market value and nominal position value of the collateral held in other cash deposits were both $812,281. Lastly, the total net assets' current market value was approximately $311,837,918, with a nominal position value of about $305,739,282.

detailed_analysis.title: PYUSD Joins Universal Digital Payments Network to Address Traditional Payment Challenges
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on February 9th that Paxos announced its collaboration with PayPal to issue the PYUSD stablecoin, which has joined the Universal Digital Payments Network. This move aims to help PYUSD better address the high costs, complex processes, and slow settlement issues typically associated with traditional payment mechanisms. The Universal Digital Payments Network is a global messaging network based on Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT), designed to bridge the gap between traditional payment infrastructure and modern digital currencies.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal Ventures Invests $6.5 Million in Crypto Transfer Platform Mesh Using PYUSD Stablecoin
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal Ventures invests $6.5 million in crypto transfer platform Mesh, with $5 million paid in PYUSD stablecoin. This marks PayPal Ventures' first known crypto investment since May 2023. Mesh is building a product for users to move crypto between different financial accounts and wallets. The investment in stablecoins as opposed to fiat was not immediately clear. Mesh co-founder and CEO Bam Azizi expressed excitement about the investment in PYUSD, highlighting its 24/7 functionality and low cost. Despite doubling its market capitalization, PYUSD remains the eleventh-largest stablecoin. The future development and priority of PYUSD within PayPal are uncertain.

According to BlockBeats' on-chain data from January 20th, the total issuance stands at 301,175,241.4 PYUSD, with 5,162 holding addresses and 32,619 transactions recorded.

The AI-backed initiative is recognized for its potential in the DeFi space, offering a crowdfunding platform for AI startups. Meanwhile, PayPal USD (PYUSD) is set to integrate into the Aave (AAVE) lending protocol, marking PayPal's entry into DeFi. Aave's community has overwhelmingly voted in favor of integrating PayPal's stablecoin. Chainlink (LINK) is also making headlines with a 15% rally and significant network activity, indicating a push to new highs.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Exceeds Issuance Target with Over 290 Million Coins
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's stablecoin PYUSD has achieved a significant milestone by surpassing its issuance target, with over 290 million coins in circulation. On-chain data from BlockBeats as of January 17th indicates that the total issuance of PYUSD has reached 294,195,079, and the stablecoin is now held by 31,714 addresses.

detailed_analysis.title: Aave Community Approves Addition of PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin to Aave V3
detailed_analysis.body: The Aave community has voted to add PYUSD, a USD stablecoin launched by PayPal and issued by Paxos, to the Aave V3 on the Ethereum network. The stablecoin currently has a circulating supply of over $230 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Market Cap Hits $290M, Growing 70% in One Month
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin has experienced a significant increase in market capitalization, reaching over $290 million, a 70% growth over the past month. Launched in August through a partnership with Paxos, PYUSD's total supply was initially 43.3 million, with Paxos holding 90% of the supply. The stablecoin's adoption on centralized exchanges and integration into DeFi protocols have contributed to its growth. Crypto.com now holds the largest portion of PYUSD, and DeFi protocols like Curve have integrated it into their systems. On-chain activity shows a trend of PYUSD being swapped for other stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, and its daily trading volume is around $29 million.

detailed_analysis.title: PayPal's PYUSD Stablecoin Seeks DeFi Integration for Liquidity
detailed_analysis.body: PayPal's PYUSD stablecoin, which has been trailing more established stablecoins such as USDT and USDC, is leveraging DeFi to give itself a liquidity boost. PYUSD activated the Curve automated market maker in December and is seeking deployment on Aave. Despite the initial buzz around PayPal entering the stablecoin market with PYUSD, it faces challenges in trade volumes compared to leading stablecoins. To combat this, Paxos, the entity behind PYUSD, has partnered with Trident Digital to improve on-chain liquidity. The Curve platform launched the FRAXPYUSD liquidity pool, which has become the third-largest on Curve with $135 million in TVL. The pool includes FRAX Finance's collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, FRAX, and allows FRAX holders to swap for PYUSD for use on the PayPal app. Aave is currently voting on whether to onboard PYUSD into its Ethereum pool, with the initial vote ending on January 11, 2024. If successful, Paxos and associated parties plan to seed the liquidity pool with $5-10 million.
